intro: Eremosporus olivieri, commonly known as the oliveleaf eremosporus, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and other plants with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Eremosporus olivieri is known for its adaptability to harsh conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
